elements.title: reusable coffins
elements.contents: ... that Joseph II, Holy Roman Emperor, caused outrage in 1784 when he ordered that people be buried naked in reusable coffins (example pictured) from which the body fell into the grave via a trapdoor?

elements.title: George Floyd
elements.contents: ... that at George Floyd's funeral, a montage mistakenly included a photograph of the still-living former American football player George Floyd?

elements.title: Crewe Alexandra
elements.contents: ... that Crewe Alexandra finished last in the Football League eight times between 1894 and 1982, more than any other league club?

elements.title: Vikram Misri
elements.contents: ... that Vikram Misri was the Indian ambassador to China during the 2020–2021 China–India skirmishes?

elements.title: seal of Columbia University
elements.contents: ... that the intricate seal of Columbia University was the first instance in which both Greek and Latin appeared on a college or university seal?

elements.title: John Matthews
elements.contents: ... that John Matthews's pension was suspended because he was accused of leading a call for a theatre performance to play "Yankee Doodle" and "Hail, Columbia"?

elements.title: Elazığ Girls' Institute
elements.contents: ... that the Elazığ Girls' Institute was established in 1937 to assimilate "primitive" Kurdish girls by transforming them into "civilized" Turkish women?

elements.title: Alex Schaefer
elements.contents: ... that Alex Schaefer has never burned down a bank, despite all the evidence suggesting otherwise?
